entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 04 at 8:41AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .Natural flow on the Saint Johns River near Astor remains hindered due to prolonged northerly winds and tide. The river is forecast to rise into Moderate Flood Stage at 3.0 feet this morning. Only slow improvement in level is forecast into next week, with the river
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 04 at 11:24AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...INCREASED FIRE DANGER CONTINUES THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING FOR NORTHEAST GEORGIA... A dry air mass will remain in place over the region today. entry.summary: ...LOCALIZED DENSE FOG CONTINUES ACROSS THE ARCO DESERT... At 10 AM, locally dense fog was reported along US 20 and US 26 through the Arco Desert. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 04 at 11:33AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE RISK EXPECTED THIS AFTERNOON DUE TO LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY... The combination of low relative humidity and ongoing drought conditions will lead to an elevated fire risk this afternoon. Relative humidity will drop into the 20s this afternoon with generally light west and southwest winds between 5 and 10 mph.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 04 at 10:39AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Enhanced Danger of Wildfires This Afternoon... Weather conditions will favor more active fire behavior this afternoon. Dry fuels, leaf litter, low humidity and warm temperatures will create control problems for outdoor burning. High temperatures today will be in the upper 50s to lower 60s. Minimum relative humidity will be 15 to 20 percent.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Ashe; Watauga
